justification: The article refers to "complex executive functions tasks, such as the 'Tower of Hanoi' task," indicating this task is employed to measure overall executive functioning.
In the same sentence the authors list "the Wisconsin Card Sorting test" as another example of a "complex executive functions task," demonstrating its use as a measure of executive functions.
Later the paper describes "different versions of n-back, an updating task," explicitly identifying the n-back paradigm as the instrument used to assess the cognitive construct of updating.
